website_summaries.verdict: If you are working in a creative field or need the most feature-packed drawing tablet available for your digital art, this is the best model for you.
cons: This high-end drawing pad is a fairly pricy one

customer_reviews.title: vertical line dead/glitched pixels
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time buying this, after returning the previous one a month ago. The second item came all damaged with the package all opened. I expected something would go bad, and as I expected it did. After of regular use for a while I started to noticed a small blue stuck pixel on the bottom left corner, it was fine because it didn’t bother with the canvas or the art program itself. But as time passed it became much more worst than before. After that this happened, a straight line appeared. I fully not recommend buying this product, as for my experience buying it twice and getting the exact same problem already is a bad sign.
customer_reviews.author: Civibes

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Waste of Money...
customer_reviews.text: I, and many others, have spent hard-earned money on this product and it is consistently bad? Amazon, why do you still support selling for a company that practically steals money from customers? The touch funtions don't work AT ALL. I'm using a Macbook Pro and the touch funtions do not work with the mojave update. Aside from my own issues with this, many others have also voiced their disappointment (for lack of a more aggressive term) about this product and yet we can still buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful product but do your research so you can get 4K
customer_reviews.text: Built beautifully. Touch is an amazing feature I didn’t know I needed. Drawing on it is amazing. Make sure you do plenty of research before you buy. Make sure your machine can output 4K. I needed to get a display port to mini display port cable to get this tablet to work off my nvidia 1080TI GPU. I love how all the cables go through the Wacom link plus box and you only have to plug the tablet in with a single usb c port.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Nicolosi

customer_reviews.title: It's great but doesn't come with hdmi
customer_reviews.text: The USB cord that came with it didnt do its job.. I had to use both the hdmi and the USB for my computer to recognize it, and it took hours before we found out we needed a different hdmi and it worked fine. I feel it should come with a compatible hdmi as well as the USB, it was a lot of trouble.. but so far it is a really great tablet, I definitely like it better than my old one, I love the fact that i can calibrate and change a lot of settings.. it would've been 5 stars if i hadn't been trying to connect it to my computer for over 4 hours 😅😅😅
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive - but WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: Let's face it - Cintiq is the best you can buy for Drawing tablets. Expensive, but if you want quality of use this is it. I purchased a X-PEN 22 pro e last year and have used it until I bought this one. I was really worried about going from 22inch down to 16 inches but it really hasn't been an issue - actually it has freed up a little desk space. If you have the cash i would definitely not hesitate to purchase this or any other Cintiq.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Buck

customer_reviews.title: Wish it didn't need a separate power supply
customer_reviews.text: So, either you want a Cintiq Pro or you don't. The tablet works well with Windows 10, and Adobe CC, really nothing to complain about. I just wish it could grab power from the USB-C port, but I understand that it probably isn't possible given the display power draw. Yes, they have a dock-like thing that enables just one cable coming off the tablet, it works, it's just super clumsy and adds a rats nest of cables to my desk. So, sticking with two cables to the tablet for now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McDonald

customer_reviews.title: My work now takes half the time and is twice as fun
customer_reviews.text: I’m a visual novel writer/developer, animator, and illustrator. This has become my most useful tool in my arsenal. Coming from a screenless pen tablet, I’m blown away with how efficiently I can make art. There’s NO lag, setup is as easy as plugging in two cords. My work time has been cut AT LEAST in half. There is a cost. And my word, is it cost. That’s the same price as a really nice desktop. BUT you do get a beautiful 4K screen with touch input, pressure sensitivity, an incredibly smart and powerful pen, and everything you might need all included. I don’t think it would be possible to regret saving up for this. Best purchase I’ve made in ages.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Frentz

customer_reviews.title: Where did all of the bad reviews come from? WHere's a fitted sleeve?
customer_reviews.text: I have both: Cintiq Pro 13, Pro 16. Great unit and very pleased with the quality and the productivity I get. The Wacom sleeve is way too big! Don't buy it! It fits the INTUOS PRO line up but is way too big for the Cintiq Pro. I have purchased 3rd party sleeves and they don't fit (too bulky). WHY DOES WACOM, AN ALMOST $1B/YR COMPANY, NOT MAKE A FITTED SLEEVE AVAILABLE TO FIT INTO A BACKPACK. WHY?????
customer_reviews.author: Software Maniac

customer_reviews.title: Vertical Line
customer_reviews.text: Bought November 17th 2019. Only a little over 3 months later and I have a vertical line on my screen directly in the center of the screen. How can this happen with such an expensive product? I've never had this happen on a monitor before.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: Device not recognized after 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: This product was always a bit glitchy with the drivers. However, after 3 months of use, it stopped being recognized at all. Mac Mojave 10.14.4. So disappointing. Beautiful screen and works well when it worked. I’ve been on chat with Wacom support for 4 days. Now they are suggesting I send it in for repair.
customer_reviews.author: inkyspace

customer_reviews.title: Buggy with Mojave
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because it wasn’t compatible with the latest OS Mojave. I kept losing connection, or getting weird, double cursors. Long time user of Wacom products. Went through support and nothing would fix the bug. I returned it. Using old intuos until I can find something else. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Holly S McCaig

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: One of the most terrible purchases I've ever made. Constant connection problems between the tablet and my MacBook Pro. It also blocks sound its sound. Constant pen calibration issues. For every few lines I draw I have to restart the machine and reconfigure the settings. Given the steep price the experience should have been flawless. Far from it.
customer_reviews.author: Spyros Tsiounis

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good tablet.
customer_reviews.text: It bought mine almost 3 months ago, and so far it’s been great. It took me about an hour to set it up, there’s no detailed instructions and I had to use google to find a tutorial video. The tablet itself works great.
customer_reviews.author: Hana

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Not all USB-C are created equal
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, you must have a specific type of USB-C port (it must support DisplayPort Alternate Mode). If you do not have this specific kind of USB-C port, you will have to use the Wacom Link along with a mini-DisplayPort and USB-A cable (for 4k resolution) or an HDMI and USB-A cable for QHD resolution. I have 2 monitors already on my DisplayPort connections, so I have none to spare, and what is the point of having a 4k-capable device running in a lower resolution? Total fail for Wacom, and I am typically a big fan of their devices. Very disappointed and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonwolf

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product...
customer_reviews.text: To this day, I cannot get this to connect to my computer. I have purchased tons of addition cables, adaptors, connectors, and still, nothing. Their silly installation videos are horribly simple and limited. So bad. DO NOT purchase this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Nieto

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: Kept losing it's USB connection to the PC. Unreliable. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: GLG

customer_reviews.title: Playmobile TV that costs as much as a vehicle...
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I just dropped nearly two thousand dollars on a playmobile TV that doesn't have the neccesary cables to connect it to a PC. This was so bad I laughed and thought that it would be worth the 2k to throw it off my balcony to save others the horror! It does not connect to your PC with any of the three options provided, and has such latency as if a little boy in bangladesh is translating your cursor on the washed out screen. This device is why artists are depressed.
customer_reviews.author: Miles Beler

customer_reviews.title: The Cintiq Pro product line has mechanical stress issues. ...
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: As of 9/2/2018 I have not heard back from Wacom. Also, new driver 6.3.30-6 breaks PaintTool SAI & Clip Studio Paint on windows 10. Lots of compatibility issues with windows users. The Cintiq Pro product line has mechanical stress issues. Frame buckling under a month of use. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: thappyboy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: After trying several different cable combinations over the coarse of a couple of weeks, the tablet finally started to work. A day later, it no longer connects. More cables, driver re-installs, etc... still no video detected. Seems to work some computers but not on others. Very finicky on windows. Definitely not worth the frustration. You can google all the issues people have with getting this thing to work. Luckily we don't yet have the dead zone issue.
customer_reviews.author: Dozer The Cat

customer_reviews.title: THUMBS DOWN, unless you like frustration
customer_reviews.text: I feel robbed.... I waited years to afford a cintiq thinking it was going to launch my creativity to higher levels ... instead I am constantly reverse engineering why the latest driver update no longer supports OSX... no more touch on screen, constant pen calibrations ... WIRES ???, what about bluetooth and batteries ?, its 2019 and I'm tangled in wires to attach my tablet to my laptop... WTF? I will not be replacing this product with another wacom product unless apple buys them out and fixes their engineering stupidity.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: it is a pain, and gabage
customer_reviews.text: i try 3 hours , and still can not use the drivers, I read review online and I think is fine , because is already a year, but nop, still can not use it do any thing, because the drive did not working and all
customer_reviews.author: ellen li

customer_reviews.title: 1700 for a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend uses a 27 inch one with very little issues. This product however, is a piece of $#(@. I regret purchasing it. Too many problems that all the above reviewers addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Pak

product_meta.title: Wacom DTH1620AK0 Cintiq Pro 16" Graphic Tablet with Link Plus,Black
product_meta.description: Style:Cintiq Pro NewFor professional artists and designers who want to add a world class pen on screen creative experience to their Mac or PC, Wacom Cintiq Pro offers Wacom's most powerful array of capabilities in a high performance 15.6" creative pen display. The Cintiq Pro 16 features the Wacom Pro pen 2 with 4X higher pen accuracy and pressure sensitivity, 4K resolution display (3840 x 2160) and exceptional color performance (94 percent Adobe RGB) in a compact display. In addition to a complete range of helpful creative features such as on screen radial menus and multi touch controls, the new Cintiq Pro 16 attaches easily to your Mac or PC with a simple USB connection. It has never been so easy to experience the Joy of creating with the powerful new Wacom Cintiq Pro.
feature_bullets: Remarkable clarity with high resolution display and superior color quality (94 percentage Adobe RGB). Maximum display resolution up to 4K(3840 x 2160)
Displayable colors (maximum): 16.7 million, brightness: 250 cd/m2; Wacom's most natural and advanced pen performance with 4x greater accuracy and pressure sensitivity and virtually lag free tracking
Multi touch gestures, customizable Express keys (available with optional Express key remote), radial menus and one touch shortcuts to speed your workflow
The authentic feel and artistic control of the Wacom Pro Pen 2 on the etched glass screen; Nibs :10 (6 standard, 4 felt)
Integrated stand for working at an inclined angle. Compatible with Windows and Mac

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars76 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
